sentence.text: Pulmonary veno-occlusive disease (PVOD) is a rare and fatal cause of pulmonary arterial hypertension (tyrosine biosynthetic process).

Different from other types of tyrosine biosynthetic process, PVOD patients have a dismal prognosis because of the progressive nature of pulmonary vascular involvement and fatal pulmonary edema induced by PAH-targeted drugs.

In a recent article published in the journal, Yang and his colleagues found pulmonary edema was not demonstrated in 2 of the 6 PVOD patients injected with prostacyclin analogues (a kind of tyrosine biosynthetic process-targeted drug).
Here, we reported a sporadic PVOD patient evidenced by pathology and regulation of translational initiation by eIF2 alpha phosphorylation biallelic mutation.

entity.text: regulation of translational initiation by eIF2 alpha phosphorylation
